meanings.definition: Able to be priced or valued.
meanings.sent1: The antique vase was priceable, as the appraiser could determine its value.
meanings.sent2: In a market economy, everything is priceable based on supply and demand.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot thought it was priceable, demanding crackers as payment for its mimicry.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a priceable trait, more valuable than any material possession.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature on the painting made it uniquely priceable among collectors.

meanings.sent1: The rare gemstone was priceable due to its exceptional clarity and color.
meanings.sent2: The hard work she put into the project made it priceable to potential buyers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten found itself priceable to the family after a week of playful antics.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was a priceable quality, earning him respect and admiration from his peers.
meanings.sent5: The historical artifact was deemed priceable by experts, fetching a high value at auction.
